      • addConnection

        public void addConnection​(Connection connection)
        Add a connection to the graph.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the source and destination of the connection is the same waypoint.

      • addWayPoint

        private void addWayPoint​(long id,
                         org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition position)
        Add a waypoint to the graph.
        Parameters:
        id - The Id of the new waypoint.
        position - The waypoint itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a waypoint already exists with the given Id.

        Add a connection to the graph.
        Parameters:

        connection - The connection itself.
        Throws:

      • getClosestWayPoint

        public long getClosestWayPoint​(org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition pos)
        Gets the Id of the closest waypoint to a given location.
        Parameters:
        pos - The location.
        Returns:
        The Id of the closest waypoint, or a runtime exception in case no waypoints are present.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no waypoints are present in the graph.

      • getClosestWayPointWithinRange

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> getClosestWayPointWithinRange​(org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition pos,
                                                                        double range)
        Get the closest waypoint to a given location, if the closest waypoint is withing a specified range of that location.
        Parameters:
        pos - The location.
        range - The maximum range between the closest waypoint and the position (expressed in km).
        Returns:
        The closest waypoint Id if it is within the specified range, otherwise an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no waypoints are present in the graph.

      • getClosestWayPointWithDistance

        private Pair<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.Double> getClosestWayPointWithDistance​(org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition pos)
        Get the closest waypoint to a given location, including the distance between the waypoint and the location.
        Parameters:
        pos - The location.
        Returns:
        A pair of the waypoint Id and the distance (in km) to it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no waypoints are present in the graph.

      • getOutgoingConnections

        public java.util.List<Connection> getOutgoingConnections​(long wayPointId)
        Retrieve a list of connections which have the given waypoint as source.
        Parameters:
        wayPointId - The waypoint at which the connections start.
        Returns:
        A list of connections which all start at wayPointId.

      • getOutgoingConnectionsById

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getOutgoingConnectionsById​(long wayPointId)
        Retrieve a list of connection Ids which have the given waypoint as source.
        Parameters:
        wayPointId - The waypiont at which the connections start.
        Returns:
        A list of connection Ids which all start at wayPointId.

      • connectionExists

        public boolean connectionExists​(long fromWayPointId,
                                long toWayPointId)
        Check whether a connection exists between 2 waypoints.
        Parameters:
        fromWayPointId - The source waypoint Id.
        toWayPointId - The destination waypoint Id.
        Returns:
        True if a connection exists.

      • getConnection

        private java.util.Optional<Connection> getConnection​(long fromWayPointId,
                                                     long toWayPointId)
        Get the connection which starts and ends at the given waypoint Ids.
        Parameters:
        fromWayPointId - The waypoint Id at which the connection starts.
        toWayPointId - The waypoint Id at which the connection ends.
        Returns:
        Either the connection which has the right source and destination, or an empty Optional if no such connection exists.

      • deleteWayPoint

        public void deleteWayPoint​(long wayPointId,
                           Environment environment)
        Delete a waypoint in the graph. Note: this also shortens the paths of motes which make use of this waypoint.
        Parameters:
        wayPointId - The Id of the waypoint to be deleted.
        environment - The environment of the simulation.

      • deleteConnection

        public void deleteConnection​(long fromWayPointId,
                             long toWayPointId,
                             Environment environment)
        Delete a connection which starts at fromWayPointId and ends at toWayPointId. Note: this also shortens the paths of motes which make use of this connection.
        Parameters:
        fromWayPointId - The waypoint Id at which the connection starts.
        toWayPointId - The waypoint Id at which the connection ends.
        environment - The environment of the simulation.
